description: TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT TO A RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE TREATY BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND GREAT BRITAIN FOR THE ARBITRATION OF MATTERS IN DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE TWO COUNTRIES SIGNED AT WASHINGTON, JAN. 11, 1897, WHICH AMENDMENT ELIMINATES THEWORDS "WHO SHALL BE JURISTS" FROM ARTICLE III WHICH PROVIDES FOR THE NOMINATION OF TWO ARBITRATORS SELECTED BY EACH GOVERNMENT AND TWO ARBITRATORS NOMINATED BY THE PRESIDENT AND THE 4 TO BE AGREED UPON BY THE SENATE AND THE 4 ARBITRATORS SHALL THEN WITHIN...

TO TABLE THE AMENDMENT TO ARTICLE VI OF TREATY, WHICH AMENDMENT STRIKES OUT THE LAST PARAGRAPH "IN THE EVENT OF AN AWARD MADE BY LESS THAN THE PRESCRIBED MAJORITY AND PROTESTED AS ABOVE PROVIDED THERE SHALL BE NO RECOURSE TO HOSTILE MEANS OF ANY DESCRIPTON UNTIL MEDIATION OF ONE OR MORE FRIENDLY POWERS HAS BEEN INVITED BY BOTH OF THE HIGH CONTRACTING PARTIES.

TO TABLE THE AMENDMENT TO ARTICLE II OF TREATY, WHICH AMENDMENT STRIKES OUT "SHALL BE DEALT WITH" AND INSERTS IN LIEU THEREOF "MAY BE SUBMITTED TO BY AEBITRATION OF SUCH CLAIMS AFFECTING THE NATIONAL RIGHTS OF BOTH PARTIES".

TO TABLE THE AMENDMENT TO ARTICLE XIV OF TREATY, WHICH AMENDMENT STRIKES OUT AFTER OPERATION THE WORDS "AND FURTHER UNTIL THE EXPIRATION OF TWELVE MONTHS AFTER EITHER OF THE HIGH CONTRACTING PARTIES SHALL HAVE GIVEN NOTICE TO THE OTHER OF ITS WISH TO TERINATE THE SAME".
TO TABLE THE AMENDMENT TO ARTICLE I OF TREATY, WHICH AMENDMENT INSERTS "AND CONVENTION" AND "TREATY" AFTER WORD "NEGOTIATION".
TO TABLE THE AMENDMENT TO ARTICLE I OF TREATY, WHICH AMENDMENT INSERTS THE WORD "OTHERWISE" AFTER THE WORD "FAIL" AND BEFORE WORDS "TO ADJUST" ALSO TO STRIKE OUT "BY DIPLOMATIC NEGOTIATION".

TO TABLE THE AMENDMENT TO ARTICLE I OF TREATY, WHICH AMENDMENT INSERTS AFTER PHRASE "CONTINUE IN FORCE" THE PHRASE "NOR SHALL ANY CLAIM AGAINST ANY STATE OF THE UNITED STATES, ALLEGED TO BE DUE TO THE GOVERNMENT OF GREAT BRITAIN, OR TO ANY SUBJECT THEREO, BE A SUBJECT MATTER OF ARBITRATION UNDER THIS TREATY".

TO TABLE THE AMENDMENT TO ARTICLE VII OF TREATY, WHICH AMENDMENT STRIKES OUT "OBJECTIONS OF THE JURISDICTION OF AN ARBITRAL TRIBUNAL CONSTITUTED UNDER THIS TREATY SHALL NOT BE TAKEN EXCEPT AS PROVIDED IN THIS ARTICLE".
TO TABLE THE AMENDMENT TO ARTICLE VI OF TREATY, WHICH AMENDMENT STRIKES OUT ALL OF ARTICLE VI.

TO TABLE THE AMENDMENT TO ARTICLE VIII OF TREATY, WHICH AMENDMENT STRIKES OUT IN FIRST PARAGRAPH "JUDICIAL OFFICE" AND INSERTS IN LIEU THEREOF "JURISTS OF REPUTE".

TO TABLE THE AMENDMENT TO TREATY, WHICH AMENDMENT STRIKES OUT IN ARTICLE VIII THE PROVISION THAT IN CASES WHERE QUESTION INVOLVED IS ONE WHICH CONCERNS A PARTICULAR STATE OR TERRITORY OF THE U.S., THE PRESIDENT CAN APPOINT A JUDICIAL OFFICER TO BE ONE OFTHE ARBITRATORS UNDER ARTICLES 3,5, OR 6 AND LIKEWISE IN SIMILAR CASES INVOLVING A BRITISH COLONY OR POSSESSION HER BRITANNA MAJESTY MAY ALSO APPOINT A SIMILAR ARBITRATION.
